column4: Help!  Trying to install Ubuntu 64-Bit 8.10 onto a Toshiba Satellite A355D series laptop (AMD Turion x2 64-Bit) - installation never finishes, it just dumps me into Terminal.
does it give you any sort of error or status message?
Negative.  Just the prompt: ubuntu@ubuntu:~$
that's weird. Dunno what to tell you.
Tried running startx, but I get a weird error.
there's your problem. USA is where it's at :)
They got the best servers here in Japan, dude.  :p
i've never used the windows install, dunno how reliable it is
you can always try a live CD install, those are more common
if you can figure out how to burn a working Live CD, you'd probably have better luck
wubi is the name of the ubuntu installer from windows
For whatever reason, I get the same damn results running live CD.
okay, that's weird
it's a bit of a pain. YOu'd be better off burning a live CD
winmd5sum will check the checksum for you, but i doubt that's your problem
that clears it up. You obviously don't have a monitor. Go out and buy one.
Your kidding, right?
You think my problems could stem from Toshiba's rabid support of Vista?
it's probably not intentional on anyone's part
i'm guessing it has to do with your unusual install setup
oh, wait, but you said live cd has the same problem :/
i really don't know what the problem is. Have you googled for the error you pastebin'd?
